title: Historical Stock Splits and Corporate Actions for AMETEK Inc

content.text: In June 1997, AMETEK Inc announced a 2-for-1 stock split. Shareholders received one additional share for each share held, effectively doubling the number of outstanding shares.
In March 2000, AMETEK Inc executed a 2-for-1 stock split. This split also increased the number of shares outstanding.

In November 2004, AMETEK Inc acquired Chandler Engineering, a leading manufacturer of pressure and flow calibration instruments. This acquisition expanded AMETEK's product portfolio and strengthened its position in the market.
In June 2007, AMETEK Inc implemented a 2-for-1 stock split. The split aimed to make the stock more accessible to individual investors and increase liquidity.

In February 2011, AMETEK Inc completed the acquisition of Coining Holding Company, a manufacturer of engineered electronic components. This acquisition further diversified AMETEK's business and expanded its customer base.

In April 2013, AMETEK Inc announced a 20% increase in its quarterly cash dividend. This decision reflected the company's strong financial performance and commitment to delivering value to shareholders.

In July 2014, AMETEK Inc acquired Dunkermotoren GmbH, a global supplier of advanced motion control solutions. This acquisition enhanced AMETEK's capabilities in the automation and precision motion control market.
In January 2019, AMETEK Inc raised its quarterly cash dividend by 17%. This increase demonstrated the company's consistent growth and its ability to generate strong cash flows.
